example[0]: He was recently appointed chief economist at the Bank of Scotland.
example[2]: One of the chief causes of crime today is drugs.
example[4]: The chief reason for this is that people are living longer.
example[5]: his chief rival for the job
example[7]: She had many reasons for taking the money, but chief among them was revenge.
signpost[0]: somebody in charge of an organization
definition[2]: the most important person, or one of the most important people, in a company or organization – used especially in job titles and in news reports
example[8]: Most health chiefs believe the reforms have gone too far.
example[10]: Los Angeles Police Chief Willie L. Williams
example[11]: They offered him the position of editor-in-chief.
example[12]: the British Chief of Defence Staff
example[13]: the Zulu leader, Chief Mangosuthu Buthelezi
